website_summaries.verdict: A handy, moderately priced kit that includes a drill, a 2-sided number-2 Phillips bit, 2 batteries, a charger, a carrying case, and a flashlight.
pros: This Hitachi drill driver features a comfortable ergonomic grip and a 1/2-inch keyless chuck that allows for a quick change of bits
Has high and low power setting
Unit comes with a powerful flashlight
cons: Rarely, a faulty unit slips through, but Hitachi stands behind its products with impressive warranties on both its tools and the batteries

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 years of light use
customer_reviews.text: The drill broke after a few years of light use. It stopped spinning as I was driving a screw into some wood despite a fully charged battery. Otherwise, it is an adequate drill although not super powerful. I was very disappointed at its longevity. Theoretically you can take it into an authorized repair center to be repaired under warrantee, but no repair center within 50 miles actually repairs cordless drills. I filed a warrantee claim with Metabo-HPT (which now owns Hitachi) and I will see if they honor the lifetime warrantee.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE it for around the house tasks.  Best drill I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I so love this drill. I bought it because it was very highly rated on Consumer Reports and the rating is earned. It is light and fast and powerful enough to do all of my around the house tasks. I don't know what else to say than it is so much better than any corded or cordless drill that I have ever used in my life. Power, precision, ease of use, feel are all great. It is also one of the least expensive quality drills. I can't tell you if this will work for contractor grade work, but for around the house it is terrific. The light...eh, it's pretty pathetic, but you can just not bother with it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Behnke

customer_reviews.title: Drill works great, batteries not so much
customer_reviews.text: I really like the drill. It fits my hand well and has plenty of power. I was planning on switching from Craftsman battery tools over to Hitachi but now I am not sure because one of the two batteries from this set will not charge. I have only had light use of the tools, nothing heavy duty or nothing where I have completely exhausted a battery but now one battery works fine, the other is dead. Now I am not sure if I should invest more in the Hitachi line or switch to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Chaney

customer_reviews.title: It was useless from that point forward
customer_reviews.text: The warning are correct. After 30 minutes of drilling wood the drill bit began to wobble. It was useless from that point forward. Fortunately after so short of use I still had the box to return. This drill may be OK for driving screws but you may be sure that if you are drilling it won't last for more than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: W. T. Atlantic General

customer_reviews.title: great foundation kit for Hitachi tool system
customer_reviews.text: great foundation kit for Hitachi tool system - two batteries are supplied. been using it for house deck work and making container for raised garden bed. totally lives up to high rating from independent non-profit consumer ratings organization. recommend getting hex to 1/4in square and hex to 3/8in square drive adapters to use with hex sockets (handier than manual ratchet drive). also very pleased with the C18DGL Circular Saw (purchased separately)
customer_reviews.author: Martouf

customer_reviews.title: Love the flashlight
customer_reviews.text: Love the flashlight! The drill isn't as powerful as my Black and Decker one though. I mainly bought it for the batteries though. Didn't NEED the drill so I just use my old one. Drill is good will drill-bits, but when using as a screwdriver, it doesn't turn the screw if it is a semi-tight one. It works for me though since now I don't have to switch my B&D back and forth between drill and screwdriver bits. I just leave the drill bits in this one. Nice carry case too! Wish it had a few spare compartments though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’ve had enough problems
customer_reviews.text: First I needed the truck to be replaced because that wasn’t working. Later the battery charger stopped working. Now something else is wrong. I suspect it’s the battery charger again. I’ve had it. I’ve got two Dewalts. I’m trashing the Hitachi and buying another Dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: wntrpakr

customer_reviews.title: Much Superior than the NICad versions
customer_reviews.text: I had another set like this one but with NiCad batteries and not as powerful, much lower end drill. It was fine until the batteries wouldn't hold a charge anymore and replacements cost more than a new drill. I saw this one in the Amazon Open Box Deals. For the significant discount, I couldn't resist. It comes highly recommended from Consumer Reports and with Lithium Ion batteries should last much longer. So far, so good. It charges fast and has lots of power. Battery life is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Paul K. Beatty

customer_reviews.title: Light, powerful, recharges quickly
customer_reviews.text: I have used this drill for a number of projects and very pleased with performance, weight, and balance. The variable speed trigger is gradual in increasing speed when you need finishing torque. The LED light is OK but not very bright. The battery recharges in less than 30 minutes. I bought this with the plastic case which is excessively large. The flashlight is odd - lithium-ion battery and incandescent bulb. It has no focal point in illumination. Replaced with xenon bulb and is much brighter and has focal point. I didn't think I would use the flashlight much but it has proved very handy especially with the swivel allowing you to set it down and point at work area.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Scaggs

customer_reviews.title: IT DID WORK GOOD, AND IS LITE WEIGHT SO YOUR HAND DOESN'T ...
customer_reviews.text: WE HAVE HAD SO MANY ISSUES WITH THIS. IT COSTS YOU TO SEND IT IN THEY PAY TO SEND IT TO YOU. THIS IS THE 2ND TIME SENDING THINGS BACK TO THEM SO IT KEEPS COSTING YOU. WHEN IT DID WORK, IT DID WORK GOOD, AND IS LITE WEIGHT SO YOUR HAND DOESN'T GET TIRED SO EASILY.
customer_reviews.author: Cleea Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value pro drill
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the unit, this model comes with a case with plenty of room for more than the drill, batteries, and light. Flashlight is very bright. Balance of the tool is fine, drill light shines where you need it. Power is great. As others said only notable missing concern is no place to attach extra bits to the drill. I didn't see this as a big deal. Great Value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Tom from Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Good combination of power and price
customer_reviews.text: Good combination of power and price. It's an older model but an old review makes it very popular. You won't find these on a construction site where Makitas and DeWalts rule but all my friends who handled it immediately noticed how much power it packed. Battery lasts for days or weeks. The main con is the plastic chuck that strips easily when rubbing against surfaces in tight spaces, and there's no indication how to replace it. It's not a heavy duty piece of gear but I expect it will last very long with proper handling.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this product thinking im buying QUALITY, since i had many hitachi power tools, i send the charger to you for repairs, it was ok for few months but it failed again, very surprised that a product like HITACHI which was a excellent brand would fail again, i guess i was wrong, i want my money back or a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Great drill ... even on cement
customer_reviews.text: I used it to install a commercial A/C ductless system. I had to drill holes 6 inches into the cement. I had to drill a hole through steel reinforced cement wall (hollow interior, walls were about inch thick on both with wood in between). I had numerous screws. Then, I took it into the shop and screwed in several small screws through weak wood. I had to make sure that the torque was set to light. It didn't matter what I threw at it. It did the job. And, the battery lasted and kept going. Also, the light from the flash was bright and came in handy at night.
customer_reviews.author: MattK

customer_reviews.title: Easy math
customer_reviews.text: Buy two batteries (for less than their cost) and they throw in a charger, bulletproof 1/2" drill, a hokey flashlight and a case that can fall off of your truck with said flashlight in it, without your caring because you weren't really ever going to put the drill back anyway. Hitachi does it again. Eons ago I tried avoiding foreign tools. Now you can't. There are no US tools to choose from. This is the top of the heap in my estimation. And you can drop them from high places. Something of a bonus. Buy it. 5 stars if the fifth star didn't say love it.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Drill is not so good.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying that I like Hitachi tools. At least their nail guns. I have an angled finish nail gun, two 23 ga pin nail guns and a framing nail gun. I've had zero problems with them and would highly recommend them to anyone. This drill is not so good. It started smoking and quit working while drilling a small hole in some metal. I finished up the job with an old Ridgid drill that this one was supposed to replace. I typically have to replace my cordless drills every 2 years or so. I don't know if this was just a bad one or not, but I rely on my tools to much to try again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Haby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It is easy to use and powerful. The lithium batteries are superior to the old NiCads and smaller. The drill itself is small enough to fit into spots that my old drill didn't, yet it has a lot more torque when I need it. This drill is highly rated on other consumer sites and the hype is real. I highly recommend this drill. NOTE: There is a newer model that costs less. My regret is that I didn't get the newer model, but I am having fun with this one.
customer_reviews.author: CHUCK

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi DS18DSAL 18 Volt 1/2-inch Drill/Driver
customer_reviews.text: This drill is light of weight and well balanced. It has a light directed to your work area. Has lots of torque and adjustable clutch is a nice feature. Comes with two Li ion batteries and a charger. The light is superfluous, and it's expense could have been better sent on driver/bit attachments. Lacks a holder for bits on the drill. The case is far too large. The belt holder is ok. I've only used it about 45 minutes thus far, but if it is the same high quality a my other Hitachi tools, I expect it will be a good tool for years.
customer_reviews.author: DES

customer_reviews.title: Great, great drill
customer_reviews.text: Great, great drill. Nice balance, lots of power. Had a 14.4NiCad cordless drill for years until it finally wouldn't hold a charge (I think it was 8 years...). This one is a bit pricier than others but the drill/light/2-batteries combo is absolutely worth every penny and I expect the batteries will probably outlive me. Oh... and it will drill through just about anything. Really. Just pressing the trigger is the difference between a .22 and a .357...
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is good but don't let it fall off a table the ...
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is good but don't let it fall off a table the battery clips on the drill it self will break. Mine fell off the table about a month after I bought it and the clip on the drill broke on both sides. I have to us tape to keep it on, but the drill still works good and is very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G.

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome little drill
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little drill. This is my third one as when the batteries go bad it is as cheap to buy the whole new drill kit as just buying two new oem batteries. Only drawback with this drill is there is no built in chuck/bit holder. I bought an aftermarket bit holder that goes on it & it works great. Very strong drill with great torque & also tough. I drop them pretty often & the battery will pop out sometimes but it goes back in & keeps on working. Price is very good for this kit & the flashlight is very handy also.
customer_reviews.author: Bill H

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product. Of course
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. Of course, cordless drills are one of the most useful tools ever invented and manufactured. Of course, it is notably much lighter than my Porter Cable 14.4 NICad - I think about 25 years old and going strong - which I love for its torque and balance in my hand. The Hitachi published torque is greater than the Porter Cable but it also has the larger voltage lighter battery making it comfortable to use for extended amounts of time.
customer_reviews.author: Hagar

customer_reviews.title: Let me Drill You....
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cordless drill that was rated #1 by many independant reviewers for speed, battery length, weight, you name it......it works like a charm and has made my life so much easier around the house, now that I have it I don't know how I lived without it before. I also bout the drill bit set that was offered with it, see my review, and the two of them together can do any job. Plus the Green color is pretty cool.....
customer_reviews.author: Erik Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice drill set, I picked up on a Amazon 8 hour sale ($99). After using it for a couple of days, I was at a Home Depot and tried out a Makita 18v drill, they are very, very similar in construction. Drill has plenty of power and the batteries last for a long time. I might get a 3.0ah battery for a big job coming up. The flashlight while not using a premium bulb is plenty bright and the rotating head is great for placing the beam where you need it.
customer_reviews.author: brokenwave

customer_reviews.title: Lightning deal!
customer_reviews.text: Great drill probably the best i've ever owned. Love that it comes with 2 batteries. holds a charge like no other. Also, the drill has great adjust-ability. The light is super bright too. Can't see myself using it much, since it is kind of large and the simple flashlight i keep in the junk drawer does the job just fine. However, could be good for peering into engine compartments and such, However, back to the drill A+ on all categories. Its light enough that my girlfriend can use it too
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Stoops

customer_reviews.title: No warranty on the charger
customer_reviews.text: Chargers burnt out. You know what they cost? Almost as much as the whole kit did. Be aware
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for an older Hitachi that we had almost worn out while building a couple of houses and other projects. We had a Bosch that was larger and heavier, and was harder for my small hand to hold on to, so I got the first one for myself. However, it was such a good tool that it soon became the only one either of us would use. This is a wonderfully well balanced hand tool, and a real workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Good unit, but not powerful for hardwoods
customer_reviews.text: I like the driver - it is conveniently small and light. It does a good job for most basic and light carpentry applications. That covers most of what I need it for. Buyers should, however, be aware that it does not have the strength to repeatedly drill through hardwood easily. For me, it just means I pull out a larger, heavier drill on those occasions - no big whoop. I look forward to using this drill and seeing how long the drill and batteries last.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Powerful little drill. I also like the high low speed settings. They come in handy when drilling through tiles. One design issue, is the location of the reverse button. It is in the way, and will be activated unintentionally at times. I used this drill extensively already, and can't find anything wrong with it. The batteries recharge within 40 minutes and last a good while.
customer_reviews.author: AGrieb

customer_reviews.title: I like it. Two things that are especially helpful are ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it much, but so far, I like it. Two things that are especially helpful are that the grip handle is small. It fits my small hands very well. The other is the light weight. That makes it handle better and is less fatiguing over time. I haven't yet done any really demanding jobs so I can't tell you about power or battery life. One small complaint; the plastic carrying case is overkill. It must also be used for a much larger drill. It's huge!
customer_reviews.author: Larry S Bothe

customer_reviews.title: Charger failed
customer_reviews.text: This drill worked fine, but the charger failed after fewer than 10 charge cycles. It was just over a year after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: This is the STRONGEST portable drill I have owned so far in my life. I don't do commercial building of any sort and haven't since I was a teen. I have ; however owned several battery operated drills and drivers during my lifetime. This is the best i have owned so far. I can counter-sink a screw without having to drill first. I would't, but could.
customer_reviews.author: L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: good drill, good batery, light, perfect for home projects
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this drill. Perfect for home projects, hold battery well, the light is very bright and it does help with looking at small dark spaces. The clip on the drill is our favorite, you don't need to find a place to put the drill, just hang it on your pants, perfect! The only negative, the box it comes in it's much too big for the product, but we had a tool box we put it in, much better fit.
customer_reviews.author: claudiajs227

customer_reviews.title: Good Drill
customer_reviews.text: This drill has done everything I needed it to. I haven't done any heavy-duty work with it yet, but I'm confident it will do fine for all my drilling needs. It has drilled many holes for putting in toddler cabinet/drawer latches, curtain rods, and furniture modifications with ease. It's more compact than the DeWalt drills I use at work, but it seems to be just as capable.
customer_reviews.author: CaliforniaTexan

customer_reviews.title: ... has very powerful motor with adjustable torque and is perfect for all my many needs
customer_reviews.text: This drill set has very powerful motor with adjustable torque and is perfect for all my many needs. The accompanying light is perfect for all difficult to see projects including working under a vehicle. The batteries are interchangeable so you can charge one while using the other for either drill or light. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: good and bad
customer_reviews.text: Big torque, nice kit, flashlight 2 batts.... broken clutch! Drilling many 2 inch holes with holesaw, self feed bit... now the clutch slips. Options buy the bare tool, or something else.update.I was running this drill hard on high. It was pretty hot when the clutch was slipping. Used it again days latter and now it works good. I guess it goes into a mode when hot, ok. Overall better. I'll add back some stars.
customer_reviews.author: jaycee

customer_reviews.title: its brushes are easily replaceable, and the light is good too
customer_reviews.text: Very light for such a strong motor, its brushes are easily replaceable, and the light is good too, hopefully I can find a CREE setup for the light. The drill is awesome, its super strong and light and will prob last a lifetime if C(in my case a lot) it is kept in a safe place as to not get stolen... Only drawbacis its not a hammer drill also, like my last Hitacthch 3/8, look into it if you use a hammer drill a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful J

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: For usual houses in CA (with wooden walls), it's a great drill, which works reliable and fast. Have not tried to drill into harder surfaces than wood yet. For my purposes (occasional drilling) the battery life is good, I have to recharge it 1-2 a year. It failed a few times as a driver, especially when the screw is very tight. Then you have to use regular screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Marek

customer_reviews.title: drill
customer_reviews.text: great drill I needed a replacement and this is it. great and powerfull
customer_reviews.author: Pete Guillory

customer_reviews.title: Second unit
customer_reviews.text: I have had many drills thru the years. This is my second Hitachi unit. My Ryobi that I kept in the barn finally died so I replaced it with this. One in the barn keeps me from walking back to the house basement when needed. Seems like my drill was never where it was needed. Problem solved. My first one is 4 years old and working just great. Batteries are excellent. John
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill for DIYers.
customer_reviews.text: This product did everything I expected from it and more. I purchased it for a DIY garage project I was working on and wanted something more powerful for drilling wood screws into studs then the wireless Makita it was replacing that often stopped or overheated when drilling screws into dense wood. Items that stand out: Ease of Use- 10 Power of drill- 10 Battery Life - 10
customer_reviews.author: A. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: ... this drill for a while now and it's been terrific. Lightweight but yet it's handled occasional heavy tasks
customer_reviews.text: I've had this drill for a while now and it's been terrific. Lightweight but yet it's handled occasional heavy tasks. Batteries so far have kept their charge for a good amount of time. Light that came with the kit isn't really necessary but I'll admit that I've used it a few times to get a better look at what I'm working on.
customer_reviews.author: the toy cannon

customer_reviews.title: Quite pleased
customer_reviews.text: Surprising! Lightweight and well balanced. A lot of torque to power through what the average guy might want to do and the built in LED light is a plus. Easy to handle without causing a lot of fatigue. Battery takes about 40 minutes to recharge. Not unhappy at all and would definately by this unit again. Doesn't hurt that it's rated top of the line by Consumer Reports either.
customer_reviews.author: Merkel M.

customer_reviews.title: Was hoping it would last longer.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this drill 3 years now and all of a sudden it made a sound internally and quit. I thought these drilled were supposed to last. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Drill on the market !
customer_reviews.text: This set is all you need . Rugged and lightweight . The light is a big plus for drilling in a shady area. My old drill split in half from the many times it got dropped from a high ladder over the years . I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: shine on

customer_reviews.title: Turned out to be a really great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I own (or have owned) all the major brands... DeWalt, Makita, Milwaukee, etc and this drill has been as good as any of them and it costs less. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Patton

customer_reviews.title: I turned the settings a few times and its worked fine since so its not bad
customer_reviews.text: well when I first turned it on it smoked and did nothing. I turned the settings a few times and its worked fine since so its not bad. Its an ok back up. Still preffer my Ridgid, Though the Hitachi does have a nice grip to it. the work light on it is not bright enough like the Ridgid is. Thank gawd a flashlight did come with it and I had to use it when using that drill. I used it to put some craftsman cabnets toghther!
customer_reviews.author: Cory Kolber

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The Hitachi is a very good cordless drill with plenty of torque and good balance. At first I thought the belt/pocket attaching clip was kind of hokey, but when I need to free my right hand doing a task, the clip is indeed handy. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality and usefulness of the work light that was included of the deal. I have already used the light several times, and is much handier than a flashlight because it stands upright and the beam is adjustable up and down. Battery life is VERY long.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Drill/driver with torque!
customer_reviews.text: This drill seems like it is going to have plenty of power for anything that I would need a drill for. I have never owned a drill that would actually twist my hand when I pulled the trigger, but this drill does. It will take time to see if the product will be as good as it seems at this first impression but I think this is going to be a good purchase. The flashlight included is an extra bonus!
customer_reviews.author: K. R. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the 30 or so I've purchased.
customer_reviews.text: We buy these for work, I've likely purchased 25-30 of them.... The guys seem to love them, I've gotten no complaints about battery life, issues, etc. All of them see daily use, 1-6 hours per day installation equipment. I'll continue to buy these as long as they are available, overall great deal compared to Dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D Keim

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time is the charm
customer_reviews.text: The 1st drill I received came very quickly but the drill would not operate because the batteries had no charge and would not take a charge. I suspect the charger was defective. Amazon gave me instructions for returning the product and within 2 days I had a fully functional replacement. I like the size, feel, and strength of the drill and am totally impressed with Amazon's customer service to correct the problem.
customer_reviews.author: E. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: It's a replacement for my old cordless drill. Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to replace my dying 12-year old Ryobi drill. What a difference. I especially like the keyless chuck which works a lot better than my old drill. The battery life is great and the batteries charge nice and fast. This drill has an LED light which my old drill didn't have. I viewed the LED light as a gimmick until I realized how useful it really is.
customer_reviews.author: Skippy the Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: very impressed powerful ,light weight , compact As light as my old Makita 9 volt that served me well in that I never used battery drill for tougher jobs , but this drill has the power of friends De Walt and is lighter handier more ergonomic . He was impressed especially with power and price . If it holds up I recommended.it Battery life is great and recharging is fast.
customer_reviews.author: P. Vanderhoof

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but another irritating case from Hitachi
customer_reviews.text: This drill has really screwed up my life. And I love it! Curtains hung. Art installed. Christmas lights up and down again. This drill does it all. If only it would go back in its case. The case is quite large and filled with plastic compartments so everything needs to be placed just so for it to shut again.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Dryden

customer_reviews.title: impressive drill
customer_reviews.text: It took me over a year to decide what type of drill to purchase, some fetches I look for were long battery life, powerful performance and dependerbility.all that I found in the Hitachi DS18DSAL cordless drill. There is one thing that was disappointing; the flash light was not a L.E.D and it using up the battery life rather quickly. I wake up each Morning with a song and a dance ready to use my drill.
customer_reviews.author: Hubert  P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill Set
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drill set. The design of this drill is almost identical to the DeWalt but a little lighter and less expensive. Does a great job and the carrying case is a nice design because it has extra room for other things.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: The power output can handle tougher jobs while letting you go easy on the more delicate ones
customer_reviews.text: As expected. The power output can handle tougher jobs while letting you go easy on the more delicate ones. I wouldn't recommend it for hard, everyday professional use. But if you have the occasional project around the house, then you certainly can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Used this less than a m onth; it broke.
customer_reviews.text: Went to Amazon; the only choice was to contact the manufacturer. So I clicked "Visit support website... which has all sorts of product lines listed, but none for the drill. So... not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Nikola Tesla

customer_reviews.title: Died after 15 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 1.22.17. Died 4.4.18. For a $180 drill, it should last longer than 15 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Reviewed first seems as good as claimed. The charger seems much larger than needed. would love a charger that takes 2 batteries at once. Hurt myself first time, my fault, went to drive a screw in wood but drill setting was on fast speed and jumped off screw and hit my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Love this set and all of the different accessories. Batteries stay charged for a long time and the drill has enough power so that I can use it for all of my handyman chores.
customer_reviews.author: Tsunami

customer_reviews.title: Great drill kit that is powerful yet light and balanced ...
customer_reviews.text: Great drill kit that is powerful yet light and balanced in use. The batteries work fine so far but I am concerned about their longevity. I would be willing to pay extra for the following improvements: 1) A battery discharge indicator to signal the need for a charge or swap before it goes dead; 2) A level bubble to ensure proper drilling angle ; 3) An LED bulb in the flashlight for longer battery life. However, the set is an excellent value at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: A light but powerful cordless drill
customer_reviews.text: I spent quite a while searching for the perfect drill for my purposes. While they aren't as powerful as the heavier units, the Makita and this Hitachi are more powerful than the older 14.4 and 12 volt systems and amazingly light. I chose the Hitachi because it included 2 batteries which I consider important. After 8 years of using a 14.4 Dewalt, this drill is a pleasure to use because of its light weight and noticeably greater power. Completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: No LED really?
customer_reviews.text: Knocking off a star because honestly the light should be an LED which would last much longer and draw much less power. The drill however is a solid 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlyn

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade from my Old Drill
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty attached to the brand of my old drill since I had it more than 10 years before it died. After reading reviews of the Hitachi drill, I took the chance and purchased it. This drill is amazing! The high torque is incredible on this drill and the LED light on the front is very convenient. I'm not sure why the drill comes with a work light, but it's kind of nice. Quit reading reviews and just buy this drill. You won't regret it.

product_meta.title: Hitachi DS18DSAL 18-Volt Lithium Ion Compact Pro Driver Drill with Flashlight
product_meta.description:
Rated "Best Buy" by a leading consumer publication and covered by Hitachi's Lifetime Lithium Ion tool warranty, the DS18DSAL is the first in Hitachi's Compact Professional series featuring an 18V Lithium Ion slide battery. It is impressively lightweight and compact at 7.7" in length and weighing only 3.3lbs. The DS18DSAL is the ideal driver drill for anyone seeking professional power in the most compact, lightweight and ergonomic tool body on the market.

AMAZON.COM
Powered by a long-lasting 1.5Ah lithium ion slide battery, the Hitachi DS18DSAL 18-Volt Compact Pro Lithium Ion Drill/Driver packs a powerful punch. Efficient and easy to handle, this variable-speed tool provides professional power in the most compact, lightweight, and ergonomically designed body currently available. For added convenience, it comes with Hitachi's UB18DAL Lithium Ion Flashlight.



Compact Design Minimizes User Fatigue Without Sacrificing Performance
The first in Hitachi's compact Pro Series of cordless tools, the DS18DSALmeasures only 7.7 inches in length and weighs 3.5 pounds, making it easy to hold and use all day without stress or strain. The compact design also provides the power and performance of a pro-grade 18-volt tool, making operation as efficient and dependable as it is comfortable.Variable Speed and 22-Stage Clutch for Versatility
This impressive driver drill features a variable speed trigger to set speed from zero to 350 RPM or zero to 1,500 RPM so you always match the right speed to the job. Additionally, the clutch has 22 driving stages and a special mode for drilling, allowing for both high torque applications and precision driving.

First-in-its-Class Torque for Heavy-Duty Jobs
With unmatched torque in its class, the DS18DSAL powers through even the toughest jobs. 460 in./lbs. of torque gives this easy-to-handle model the necessary boost to take on hardwoods, masonry, and other heavy-duty drilling.

Belt Hook, LED Light, and 1/2-Inch Ratcheting Chuck for User-Friendly Operation
The DS18DSAL comes with a convenient metal belt hook and an LED job light to illuminate your work surface. It also features a keyless 1/2-inch ratcheting metal chuck that accepts a wide variety of bits, giving you greater flexibility. Finally, externally accessible carbon brushes allow you to easily and economically replace the brushes when they are worn, thus ensuring longer tool life.

Lightweight 1.5 Ah Lithium Ion Slide Battery for Long-Lasting Power
This driver drill is powered by a long-lasting 1.5 Ah lithium ion slide battery. Designed without the vertical chamber of a post-style battery, this battery glides easily into place and allows the DS18DSAL to have an ergonomic handle. And because this Lithium Ion battery weighs roughly half as much as a NiCd or NiMH battery, you can work longer, with better accuracy. 

Steady Stream of Power for Precision and Consistency
As with all of Hitachi's lithium ion batteries, the tool receives a steady stream of power for the duration of every battery charge, from the moment the trigger is pulled until the charge cycle is exhausted. And with up to three times the number of charge cycles of traditional batteries, you won't have to waste money on costly replacements.

Included Lithium Ion Flashlight for Added Flexibility
As a bonus, the DS18DSAL comes with Hitachi's UB18DAL Lithium Ion Flashlight. Adjustable to five lighting positions, this flashlight stands alone while you work and can be aimed where you need illumination. A shoulder strap makes for easy, comfortable carrying, and a low-battery indicator light helps ensure that you don't run out of power mid-use. And because the UB18DAL runs on the same 18-volt slide batteries as the driver drill, it shares the same lithium ion benefits of long battery life, lasting power per charge, and lightweight convenience.

Warranty Information
For even more value and peace of mind, each of these tools is covered by Hitachi's 10-year lithium ion tool warranty and two-year lithium ion battery warranty.

About Hitachi: Breathing Life into a New Era
Founded in 1910 as an electrical repair shop, Hitachi offers a diverse line of professional grade power tools and accessories for woodworking, metalworking, drilling, and fastening, and concrete drilling and cutting, as well as a complete line of pneumatic nailers, staplers, compressors, and collated fasteners. From home electronics to social infrastructure, materials, logistics, and services, Hitachi maintains exacting standards of development and production while making social and environmental sustainability a key priority. They currently have headquarters in Japan, the United States, and Canada, and over 1,000 authorized service centers.

What's in the Box
Drill, flashlight, two 1.5 Ah lithium ion slide batteries, quick charger, dual-tipped Phillips driver bit, sturdy carrying case, manual, and warranty card.




FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Hitachi DS18DSAL Lithium-Ion Cordless 18-Volt Compact Driver Drill is the first in Hitachi's Compact Professional series featuring an 18-volt Lithium-Ion slide battery. The DS18DSAL is impressively compact at 7.7-inches long and weighs 3.3-pounds. This 18-volt drill generates no-load speeds ranging from 0 to 350-RPM and 1,500-RPM. It is the ideal driver drill for anyone seeking professional power in the most compact, lightweight and ergonomic body on the market. It delivers 460-inches per pound of torque to power through the toughest jobs. The new Lithium-Ion slide battery has 3-times the life at half the weight of NiCad and NiMH batteries. 22-plus-1 clutch offers (22) stages of drive settings to adjust the torque and (1) drill setting for ultimate control. External carbon brushes allow quick and easy brush changes. LED job light illuminates the work surface and is ideal in dark spaces. The 1/2-inch ratcheting keyless chuck accepts a wide range of bits and the 2-speed motor with variable speed trigger delivers more precision. This drill measures 7.7-inch long and weighs 3.3-pounds. The Hitachi DS18DSAL Lithium-Ion Cordless 18-Volt Compact Driver Drill was rated #1 Best Buy for general use drills/drivers by a leading consumer publication (Dec 2012) and comes with a lifetime Lithium-Ion tool warranty and a 2-year Lithium-Ion battery warranty. Hitachi Power Tools provides professional-grade power tools for a variety of applications, including woodwork, metalwork, concrete, drilling, cutting and fastening. Since its inception, Hitachi has pioneered innovative technologies that have improved the quality of craftsmanship worldwide. Hitachi is a leader in power tool research and development and has achieved many firsts in the power tool industry. Today, Hitachi continues the tradition of innovation and engineering with new features in addition to classic quality.
